chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Next we will talk about logical operators which check the logic of our program.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: We can write some statements like the first statement 3 is greater than 2.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: This statement will give me true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: The second statement 1 is not equal to 1.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: This statement will give me false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: The third statement 5 is less than 10.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: This statement will also give me true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: In this way, different statements can be made in our code.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Now if we want to make a logic based on these statements in our program,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then we make it using logical operators.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: The first logical operator we will talk about is logical and.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: To write logical and, we have to write 2 ampersand.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: That is, we have to write the sign of and on the keyboard twice.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: This is called logical and.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If you put a single and by mistake, it will become a bitwise operator.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Due to which an error can occur in your code.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: So do not put a single and.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: In logical operators, double and and double pipe are always used.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: The rule of logical and says that if your statement 1 and statement 2 are true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: there are some rules for them.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: This is our final answer.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If my statement 1 is true and my statement 2 is also true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then my final answer will be true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If my statement 1 is true and my statement 2 is false,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then my final answer will be false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If my statement 1 is false and my statement 2 is true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then my final answer will be false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And if both of them are false, then my final answer will be false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Logical and says that if both of my statements are true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then my final answer will be true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: In all other cases, my final answer will be false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: This is the rule of logical and.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If you are from a computer science background, then you must have heard of logical gates.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Logical gates are used in computers to make a lot of machines.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: The programming logic in computers is made up of logical and, logical or, logical not.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: We have to keep these rules in mind.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: What is the condition of and?

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: The condition of and is that if both statements are true, then the and will return true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: We have to remember this.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Logical and says that if I take statement 1 and statement 2,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: and put and and between them,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: and if it is true here and here, then my final output will be true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: In other cases, the final output will be false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Let's see this in the form of an example.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: We are going to print it.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: First of all, we will write our statement 1.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Assume statement 1 is 3 greater than 2.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Now, we know that 3 greater than 2 is a relational operator.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If this statement is true, then it will return true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And here I will put and and.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: I will give some space for clarity.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And write the second statement 5 greater than 0.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: So, statement 1 is also true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: 5 greater than 0 is also true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: I have put logical and between both.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And if I save this and run it,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then the final output will be true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Now, if I make this statement false,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: that is, 3 is less than 2,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: I know this is obviously a false statement.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: In that case, the output will be false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And if I make this statement true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then I will make this statement false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: How did I make it false?

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: I said 5 less than 0.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Then also the output will be false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And if I make both false,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: and then I execute,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then also the output will be false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: So, both the statements will be true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then only it will return logical and true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Next, let's talk about logical or.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: The rules of logical or say that

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: statement 1, statement 2

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: answer.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If statement 1 is true and statement 2 is true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then the final answer should be true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If statement 1 is true and statement 2 is false,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then the final answer is true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If statement 1 is false and statement 2 is true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then the final answer will be true in that case also.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And if statement 1 is false and statement 2 is also false,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then the final answer will be false in that case.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: That is, logical or says that

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: in the case in which both your statements are false,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then only your final answer will be false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: In all other cases, the final answer will be true for us.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If we write it in general,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then if statement 1 or or

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: the sign that we will put here,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: this is a pipe operator,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: means the single straight line will be on your keyboard.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: We have to press it twice.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Or or, we will call it or.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If statement 2 is false and this is also false,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then only we will get a false return.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If any of these becomes true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then we will get true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Let's write code and execute it.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: First of all, we will give a false statement here.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: 3 less than 2 and second false statement is 5 less than 2.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: These are both false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: What will return us false false?

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Instead of and, we give or operator.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: So false or false returns us false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: But if I make it true here,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: that is, 3 greater than 2 will return us true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Then the final answer will be true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Or I can make it false again.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And I can make 5 greater than 0.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: I made one statement true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Then it will return true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And if I make both true,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then true or true is always equal to true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: It is a very logical thing.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And whenever we write,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then both of them should be true to make it true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And whenever we write,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then any of the two will work.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Then your answer will be true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: The next logical operator we will talk about is logical and.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If you have a true statement,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: it will make it false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If you have a false statement,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: it will make it true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: That is, if you put logical and in front of the statement,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: we also call it not operator.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Not operator.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Or we also call it logical not operator.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: So if you put this exclamation anywhere,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: put logical not in front of any statement,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then the true false value of the statement inside

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: will be completely opposite.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If we have to make a table for this,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: if the rules table of logical not is made,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then it will look like this.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Where you have any statement and the final answer.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: If we have true value,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then logical not will make it false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And if we have false value,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then logical not will make it true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Let's see this too.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Apply this on a single statement.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: That is, we do not need two statements here.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: We can apply it on a single statement.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: 3 greater than 2.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: I know 3 greater than 2 will return me true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: But here if I put logical not,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then the answer will return false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: There 0 greater than 5.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: That is, the value is false.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: But here I have put not,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then it will return true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And here it will be printed true.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: So this is how our logical operators work.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: The real usage of logical operators

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: is that we think that they are operators.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: But once we read conditional statements,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: in which we will be talking about if else,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: we will be talking about switch.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: When we will be reading such things

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: in the coming sections,

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: then we will be able to see the usage

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: of logical operators and relational operators.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: And it will be very clear.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: Because it is very intuitive.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: It is not that it is very difficult to understand logic.

chunks.title: Logical
chunks.text: It is very simple like math.

chunks.title: Logical

chunks.title: Logical

chunks.title: Logical

chunks.title: Logical

chunks.title: Logical
